Course Description: From this course, we will learn about basics of blockchains and cryptocurrency. Topics to be covered include how cryptocurrency such as Bitcoin and Ethereum work, blockchain and other decentralized consensus protocols, digital coin mining, security and privacy of cryptocurrencies, scalability, cryptographic techniques for digital currency, and applications of blockchain to smart contracts, and financial exchanges.

Course Outcomes.CO1: The students are expected to learn how bitcoin and other coins work in real world.
Course Outcomes.CO2: The students are expected to understand how cryptography primitives drive blockchains and crypto-currency infrastructures.
Course Outcomes.CO3: The students are expected to understand how cryptocurrency and blockchains will move for future directions (ex. Privacy, multiparty computation, anonymity).

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Introduction to Cryptography and Cryptocurrency (Reference book Ch. 1)
Wallet: managing and protecting crypto assets (Reference book Ch. 4)
Consensus: network models, corruption tolerance, sybil resistance (Ch. 3, 6, 7 of Foundation of Consensus, http://elaineshi.com/docs/blockchain-book.pdf)
Nakamoto Consensus: : security, attacks and incentives (Ch. 14, 15 and 17 Foundation of Consensus, http://elaineshi.com/docs/blockchain-book.pdf)
Randomness beacons, VDFs, and applications to consensus (https://eprint.iacr.org/2018/601.pdf, https://eprint.iacr.org/2018/712.pdf)

Ethereum: Decentralized Apps, EVM, and the Ethereum blockchain (Ethereum white paper, Ethereum yellow paper, Solidity documentation, https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/White-Paper, http://gavwood.com/paper.pdf, https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/)

Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Mid-term Assignment: source code & video for programming assignment

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Privacy: de-anonymizing the blockchain and mixing (Reference book Ch. 6)
zkSNARKs (Zero-Knowledge Succinct Non-Interactive Argument of Knowledge): a proof construction where one can prove possession of certain information (https://eprint.iacr.org/2012/718.pdf)
zkSNARK applications: : confidential transactions and Zcash (https://eprint.iacr.org/2014/349.pdf)

Resource Material.Textbook: Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency Technologies: A Comprehensive Introduction, Princeton University Press, 2016
